ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la ne ńtsege wɔ́ɔn, à gíŋ ńdɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ńtó né ncwò jʉʼʉ Ssé. N díe ńgyá ntse ne fóo tsìŋe ssé ńkẅɛɛ ncwò lékúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ Ssé, á na shÿó sǎʼnèm. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, é ncwò we jʉʼʉ Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ shÿó sǎʼnèm. Ntse la ne ńcwóŋo na gwoŋó ye ntsíŋ na jʉʼʉ Ssé, ńcʉa shÿó ntsíŋ na jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: Then he brought me back to the entrance of the temple and there was water flowing from under the threshold of the temple toward the east, for the temple faced east. The water was coming down from under the south side of the threshold of the temple, south of the altar.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wa gÿo e fó ncwò nkáʼ na shÿó kwóŋ ńkẅɛ, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo n kéle nzème pǐ tà ńkúu na ncwò nkáʼ, á shÿó sǎʼnèm. Á gwɔ́ jʉʼó ntse ne ńcwóŋo shÿó ntsíŋ na ncwò nkáʼ.
en: Next he brought me out by way of the north gate and led me around the outside to the outer gate that faced east; there the water was trickling from the south side.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wa sẅɛʼte nnɛ́, ńdɔg ye shÿó sǎʼnèm, ńkúʼte nkÿo mbwó yé, é gwɔ́ gẅie à lɔ̌g sáŋ mefʉ̀ʼ tàʼ ntsáʼ na wɛ̌ shÿó ŋwɛ́ ḿbiŋ ńgÿo, n zyɛ́ʼɛ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ntse ŋwɛ́ kwɔ́ʼ tà ńkúu na mejÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mɔ́ɔn.
en: As the man went out east with a measuring line in his hand,   he measured off a third of a mile  # 47:3 Lit 1,000 cubits, also in vv. 4,5 and led me through the water. It came up to my ankles.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ sáŋ mefʉ̀ʼ tàʼ ntsáʼ, ńgÿo n cú ntse. É kwɔ́ʼ tà ńkúu na mekẅiʼté mɔ́ɔn, á pɔ́ɔnte ńgíŋ ḿbíi yetsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ tàʼ ntsáʼ, ntse kwɔ́ʼ tà ńkúu zẅɛ̌ʼ mèŋ.
en: Then he measured off a third of a mile and led me through the water. It came up to my knees. He measured off another third of a mile and led me through the water. It came up to my waist.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ sáŋ tsɔ́ mefʉ̀ʼ tàʼ ntsáʼ lélɔg ńzsote, n té kuʼu légíŋ ńzyɛ́ʼɛ tsoló wɔ́, á nue ntse la kwɔ́ʼ tà ńkúu na ntyě gẅie á zɛ́te lézɔ́ʼ ntse. Á la cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ máa ntse gẅie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ le zyɛ́ʼ.
en: Again he measured off a third of a mile, and it was a river that I could not cross on foot. For the water had risen; it was deep enough to swim in, a river that could not be crossed on foot.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Gù míŋ nyìŋ mesoŋ, ɔ̀ cwoŋó ńgyá mbòŋo?» Ńdɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ńnáʼa ńgʉa tà ntyě sag, ńgíŋ ńdɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ḿbiŋ né ngʉ̀ŋe máa ntse.
en: He asked me, “Do you see this, son of man? ” Then he led me back to the bank of the river.

ngiemboon: N deen ńké ńgyá metÿǒ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ na wɛ̌ wɛ̌ ngʉ̀ŋe máa ntse wɔ́ɔ.
en: When I had returned, I saw a very large number of trees along both sides of the riverbank.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wa gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie wɔɔn máa ntse cwoŋo ńdɔgɔ ye shÿó sǎʼnèm we láʼ, à cwoŋo ńkúu ye tsɛ̀ɛ fúʼu Juundʉŋ, ńzyɛ́ʼɛ ḿpfɛte tsɛ̀ɛ máŋʉ́ ngwáŋ. É gwɔ́ tà kúu tsɛ̀ɛ máŋʉ́ ŋwɛ́, ésele ntse wé, é cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ.
en: He said to me, “This water flows out to the eastern region and goes down to the Arabah. When it enters the sea, the sea of foul water,  ,# 47:8 = the Dead Sea the water of the sea becomes fresh.  # 47:8 Ex 15:26; 2Kg 2:21

ngiemboon: Nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ wɔ́ɔ gẅie máa ntse ŋwɛ́ kúu wó, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie áa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, á gẅiin légwɔ́ wó, ḿbiŋ éshʉ́a ngẅɛ̀. Messó ée tsɛ̀ɛ máŋʉ́, á nue ntse ŋwɛ́ zyɛ́ʼ tà ḿpfɛte tsoló, ésele ḿboŋ, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó, á jʉʼ gie ntse ŋwɛ́ gʉa tà ńkúu wó.
en: Every kind of living creature that swarms will live wherever the river flows,   and there will be a huge number of fish because this water goes there. Since the water will become fresh, there will be life everywhere the river goes.

ngiemboon: Á fó na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mé gẅiin pagwoon messó léfó Eyiŋ-Ngendi ńgʉa ńkúu Ayîŋ-Engalayîm, pɔ́ ge gÿo saŋte menkÿo mɔ́b, á ngʉ̀ŋe máŋʉ́. Mé gyá messó tà é gyɔ́ɔn mie ée mentí mentí wó, páʼ mie é kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ máŋʉ́ Mendítèlane
en: Fishermen will stand beside it from En-gedi to En-eglaim.   These will become places where nets are spread out to dry. Their fish will consist of many different kinds, like the fish of the Mediterranean Sea.  # 47:10 Nm 34:3; Ezk 48:28

ngiemboon: Táʼ, metsɔ́ membwó ntse mie ée ngʉ̀ŋe máŋʉ́, é té ge gÿo pú lʉ́ate wɔ́, ngwáŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ mǒ, à gwɔ́ jʉʼ gie mé ge néŋe kẅile ngwáŋ wó.
en: Yet its swamps and marshes will not be healed; they will be left for salt.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ na yɛ̌ gwoŋó máa ntse ŋwɛ́, metÿǒ mentí mentí sáʼa wó, é mie é zéme mentɔ̌ɔn. Meffo mɔ́b té láʼ júm wɔ́, metÿǒ ŋwɛ́ ké ńzém mentɔ̌ɔn pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm. Á gwɔ́ na wɛ̌ saŋ wɔ́ɔ, é zém mentɔ̌ɔn mesẅé, á nue ntse gẅie é cwóŋo ńkúu mǒ, é fóo jʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a. Mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ mɔ́b ge gÿo gwɔ́ shúm léjÿó, mé piŋ ńkáb meffo tÿǒ ŋwɛ́ ńdɔg ńzoŋ meguɔ.
en: All kinds of trees providing food will grow along both banks of the river. Their leaves will not wither, and their fruit will not fail.   Each month they will bear fresh fruit because the water comes from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be used for eating and their leaves for healing.”  # 47:12 Rv 22:2

ngiemboon: Pi júʼu mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé shÿěenshÿéen ńgɔɔn: «N ge laʼte gẅí mendège láʼ páʼ mengẅɛ̀te pa Ésàlayɛ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a ge gabte. Ngẅɛ̀te Yesyɛ̂b ge gÿo gẅiin mejʉʼ mémbʉ́a.
en: This is what the Lord God says: “This is   the border you will use to divide the land  # 47:13 Nm 34:2–12 as an inheritance for the twelve tribes of Israel. Joseph will receive two shares.  # 47:13 Gn 48:15–16

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo gabte tsetsáʼ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà n da gɔɔn tà ńkʉa ngie n ge náa láʼa Ésàlayɛ mbwó pà mángʉanjʉʼ pí, à gÿo ńcʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ gẅí tÿɔgɔ́.
en: You will inherit it in equal portions, since I swore   to give it to your ancestors.  # 47:14 Dt 1:8; Ezk 20:6 So this land will fall to you as an inheritance.

ngiemboon: Ndège láʼ we shÿó kwóŋ ge fó na máŋʉ́ Mendítèlane, é pfó na mánzsè gẅie á cʉa ye tÿǒsoŋ Heteloŋ, pɔ́ ye tÿǒsoŋ Lembo-Amad, mbɔɔ ye tÿǒsoŋ Tsendad,
en: This is to be the border of the land:

ngiemboon: é piŋ cʉa tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ Mbelota pɔ́ ye Sibalayîm mie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ láʼa lefùɔ Ndamásè pɔ́ ye Amad, ńgÿo ye Hatsɛɛ-Tikoŋ, á ngʉ̀ŋe ndège láʼ Holaŋ.
en: Berothah, and Sibraim (which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath), as far as Hazer-hatticon, which is on the border of Hauran.

ngiemboon: À cʉa púʼu, ewɔɔn ndège láʼ ŋwɛ́ fó na máŋʉ́ Mendítèlane, ńgʉa tà ńkúu na tÿǒsoŋ gie mé tóŋ lê Hatsɛɛ-Enoŋ, á shÿó sǎʼnèm. É ge gÿo gwɔ́ shÿó kwóŋ, é tsẅéʼe na láʼa lefùɔ Ndamásè pɔ́ ye Amad. Yɛ̂ lɔg ńgwɔ́ ndège láʼ ye shÿó kwóŋ.
en: So the border will run from the sea to Hazar-enon at the border   of Damascus, with the territory of Hamath to the north. This will be the northern side.

ngiemboon: Ndège láʼ ye shÿó sǎʼnèm ge fó na jʉʼ gie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Ndamásè pɔ́ Holaŋ, é lʉŋte na fúʼu Juundʉŋ, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼ pʉ̀a Ngalad pɔ́ láʼa Ésàlayɛ, é gʉa tà kúu na láʼa Tamaa à ngʉ̀ŋe máŋʉ́ ngwáŋ. Yɛ̂ lɔg ńgwɔ́ ndège láʼ ye shÿó sǎʼnèm.
en: On the east side it will run between Hauran and Damascus, along the Jordan between Gilead and the land of Israel; you will measure from the northern border to the eastern sea.   This will be the eastern side.

ngiemboon: Á ge gwɔ́ shÿó ntsíŋ, ndège láʼ fó na láʼa Tamaa, ńcʉa yé jʉʼʉ sáʼa ntse Melimba á tÿǒsoŋ Kandɛ́shÿè, é cwóŋo jʉʼʉ máa ntse Egíbtò, é gʉa tà kúu na máŋʉ́ Mendítèlane. Yɛ̂ lɔg ńgwɔ́ ndège láʼ ye shÿó ntsíŋ ngwòŋ.
en: On the south side it will run from Tamar to the Waters of Meribath-kadesh,   and on to the Brook of Egypt  # 47:19 Nm 34:5; 1Kg 8:65; Is 27:12 as far as the Mediterranean Sea.  # 47:19 Ezk 48:28 This will be the southern side.

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ shÿó mbyěnèm, máŋʉ́ Mendítèlane kẅéte lélɔg ńná ndège, léfó ntsíŋ ngwòŋ ńgʉa ńkúu na láʼa Lembo-Amad, á shÿó kwóŋ ngwòŋ, yɛ̂ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndège láʼ ye shÿó mbyěnèm.
en: On the west side the Mediterranean Sea will be the border, from the southern border up to a point opposite Lebo-hamath. This will be the western side.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo gabte ngwòŋ mbwó mengẅɛ̀te pʉ̀a láʼ pí.
en: “You are to divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo ḿmaʼa tyèente lɔg gabte tsetsáʼ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbɔɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ megʉ̀ pie é ka tó ńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ḿbiŋ ńzyé penkʉ́ pɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa gí. Mé ge gÿo gẅiin pɔɔn pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ pɔ́ páʼ mé gẅiin pʉ̀a ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ, pɔ́ piŋ ńgẅiin yɔ́b jʉʼʉ tsetsáʼ tsetsɛ̀ɛ mengẅɛ̀te Ésàlayɛ.
en: You will allot it as an inheritance for yourselves and for the aliens residing among you,   who have fathered children among you. You will treat them  # 47:22 Lit They will be to you like native-born Israelites; along with you, they will be allotted an inheritance among the tribes of Israel.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ na pɔ́b wɔ́ɔ ge gÿo gẅiin yé jʉʼʉ tsetsáʼ tsɛ̀ɛ ngẅɛ̀te gie à kà néŋe tsoló. Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé zɔ gɔɔn.»
en: In whatever tribe the alien resides, you will assign his inheritance there.” This is the declaration of the Lord God.
